member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.GetWeekNumberForDate(Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.SmartDate)
member.summary: Returns the week number for a particular date using the current and .
member.param: SmartDate
member.returns: Integer denoting the week number that the date belongs to.

remarks.p: The System.Globalization.Calendar's GetWeekOfYear method simply returns the number of weeks into the year that the date falls on. It does not seem to use the weekrule specified in the arguments. e.g. If the first day of week is sunday and the weekrule is Jan 1, then 12/31/2000 (Sunday) should return 1. Instead it returns 54 and 1/1/2001 (Monday) returns 1.
This routine returns the correct week number for the specified date based on the and .

Note, this may be a week for a year other than the year of the date. e.g. 12/31/2000, week rule of Jan 1, and week start of sunday will return 1 because this date falls into the first week of the year 2001.

This routine returns the correct week number for the specified date based on the and .

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.DataFetch
member.summary: Specifies an implementation of the IDataFetch interface WebScheduleInfo uses during it's DataBind method.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo requires an implementation to load Activity objects into the collection when data bound.

The WebSchedule data provider normally sets this property automatically when applications set their WebScheduleInfo property at run-time (or WebScheduleInfoID at design-time). When using a custom data provider, applications may need to set this property directly (please consult the documentation accompanying your custom data provider).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.DataUpdate
member.summary: Specifies an implementation of the IDataUpdate interface WebScheduleInfo uses to add and update information received from the client.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo requires an implementation to add, update and delete Activity objects from external data sources. Failure to set this property before the LoadPostData method is called by ASP.NET to process information returned from the client causes update operations to appear nonfunctional.

The WebSchedule data provider normally sets this property automatically when applications set their WebScheduleInfo property at run-time (or WebScheduleInfoID at design-time). When using a custom data provider, applications may need to set this property directly (please consult the documentation accompanying your custom data provider).

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveDayClientSynchronization
member.summary: Determines how the WebSchedule view elements attached to this WebScheduleInfo control syncronize their active day on the client.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo performs client-side active day synchronization when the changes as a result of a mouse click or programmatic assignment.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.TimeZoneOffset
member.summary: Returns or sets the timezone offset to be used to properly render activites according to the location of the client browser. This property must be set to a value between -24 and +24 hours to indicate how far away from Universal Coordinated Time, (UTC) the current locale is. By setting this property, an application can allow users to view appointments from different countries of the world and see the activities represented in their local time zone.

remarks.p: The default value for this property is WebScheduleInfo.TimeZoneServer which specifies that in whatever time zone the server is located, that timezone will be applied for WebSchedule Data and Time information displayed to the user.
Values in the TimeSpan object other than the hours and minutes properties are ignored when setting the TimeZoneOffset property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.TimeZoneServer
member.summary: Static value used for the TimeZoneOffset property to specify a TimeSpan that indicates that the Server TimeZone is to be used for rendering date/time related schedule data. This value is the default value for the TimeZoneOffset property. ()

remarks.p: The WebScheduleInfo component centralizes all the date specific state information into a single component that can be referenced from all the UltraSchedule controls (). This allows the controls to share the same information across all the controls without the need to maintain the same information on each control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.WeekRule
member.summary: The rule used to determine how the first week of the year is calculated.

remarks.p: The .NET Framework supports several calendar rules for calculating the first week of each year with it's CalendarWeekRule enumeration. WebScheduleInfo allows applications to use any of the supported calendar rules for all attached WebSchedule view elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.FirstDayOfWeekResolved
member.summary: Returns the day of the week considered the start of the week.

remarks.p: By default, the property is set to Default. When left set to this, the considered the first day of the week is based on the system settings of the system using the component.

The and FirstDayOfWeekResolved are used to calculate the date which starts the first week of the year. As such, a object is not fixed to a particular range of dates but is instead associated with a range of dates based on the calculated first week of the year. For more information on how the date of the first week of the year is calculated, refer to the method.

member.summary: Returns or sets the used as the first day of the week for various date calculations.

remarks.p: The default value for this property is Default which means that the FirstDayOfWeek used is based on the current system settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.AllowAllDayEvents
member.summary: Gets/sets whether AllDayEvents will be allowed.

remarks.p: When AllowAllDayEvents is set to false, any WebDayView attached to this ScheduleInfo will not display an AllDayEventArea. Also, the Appointment Dialog will not show an "All Day Event" CheckBox. The AllDayEvent proeprty of any appointments in the collection will be ignored and all Appointments will be displayed as though AllDayEvent were false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveDayUtc
member.summary: Returns a object representing the current active day. The active day is always in UTC.

remarks.p: The active day determines which area in the UI is current and highlighted. As the user navigates from one date to another in the UI, this ActiveDayUtc property is updated to reflect the new date that has become active.
Users can change the active day by clicking on a different day or by clicking on a navigation button to move to the next day, week or month.
An active date always has a UTC (Universal Coordinated Time) component, because the day seen as active by users from different timezones may differ.

UTC times do not take into account any "daylight savings" adjustment. If users are currently using "daylight savings" time, then the application must compensate for the one hour difference when setting the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveResourceName
member.summary: Gets/sets the resource name for the currently displayed, or active resource for all attached WebSchedule view elements.

remarks.p: A resource is the person, place, or thing, for which activities can be scheduled. The active resource is the resource whose activities are currently being displayed by all attached WebSchedule view elements.

Applications should set the ActiveResourceName property to the name of the Resource object affiliated with the schedule information end users would like to see. This name must match a value in the [ResourceName] column of the [Resource] table in the WebSchedule data model. The data model requires [ResourceName] values to be unique.
If used, this property must be set before calling the method to be effective.
Active resource names can typically be set using an end user's logon name, or some looked-up user ID value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.ActiveResource
member.summary: Returns a reference to the active Resource object for attached WebSchedule views.

remarks.p: An ActiveResource object reference is initialized automatically during the "FetchResource" operation in data binding, when the [Resource] table is accessed using the value an application has assigned to the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.LoggedOnUserName
member.summary: Identifies the currently logged on user for WebSchedule.
member.value: Returns a String value representing the currently logged on user for WebSchedule view elements associated with this WebScheduleInfo.

remarks.p: WebScheduleInfo uses this property solely for the purpose of comparing it to the . When the two properties are equivalent, reminder notifications are displayed to the end user when an Activity becomes current (it's starting time less the ReminderInterval meets or exceeds the current system time) and expire (it's starting time meets or exceeds the current system time, meaning the Activity has started and is now in the past).

Reminder notifications are suppressed if the LoggedOnUserName is not the same as the ActiveResourceName because this tells WebSchedule that the end user reviewing the active resource's activities is not their owner. Multiple users may review a schedule for one specified resource, but perhaps only one of them wishes to receive reminder notifications because the activity directly impacts him or her. The application is responsible for authenticating an end user's identity to ensure reminders are only displayed to the correct or interested users.
Reminder notifications may also be overridden if an application handles the DataBinding event and turns off the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.EnableReminders
member.summary: Determines whether reminder notifications for the are enabled by default.
member.value: Whether reminder notifications are enabled on this WebScheduleInfo (and any views attached to it); the default value is True (reminders are enabled.)

remarks.p: Determines whether the reminder dialog should pop-up for the end user when their name matches the and an activity (with a reminder enabled on it) is about to start (or has already started.) To shut off all reminders developers only need to set EnableReminders to False.
Reminders can also be turned off for an individual Resource by locating the Resource in the collection and setting it's EnableReminders property to False.

Reminders can also be disabled on individual Activity instances. Developers can set the EnableReminder property to False. When an activity has a reminder pending it renders the icon of a ringing bell (although this image is customizable.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebScheduleInfo.VisibleResources
member.summary: Returns the collection of Resource objects. Resources are used to identify the entity to which an Activity belongs. In the WebSchedule data model, there are multiple Resources, each of which can have many activities associated. The particular resource that is displayed within UI controls depends on the ActiveResource property setting. By setting the ActiveResourceName string property to a known resource in the system, the Resource object will be automatically populated from the data source.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments applying to the FrameIntervalChanging event.

remarks.p: The FrameIntervalChanging event is fired during the data binding process to mediate the date ranges required by all interested participants. Through this negotiation, the WebScheduleInfo control determines a frame interval size appropriate for the WebSchedule view elements displaying activities.

Applications can extend the FrameInterval, but cannot make it any shorter because other WebSchedule view elements would then fail to fill completely with the activities they need. Requests to shorten the frame interval are ignored. Excessively long frame intervals can negatively impact performance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.#ctor(Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameInterval)
member.summary: Constructs a FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs object.
member.param: Contains the starting date and ending date of the frame interval.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.FrameInterval
member.summary: Contains the starting and ending dates of the frame interval.

remarks.p: These dates are made available in both Universal Time (UTC) and local time. Local time is determined by the TimeZoneOffset property on the WebScheduleInfo control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.FrameIntervalChangingEventArgs.Updated
member.summary: Indicates whether an event listener has updated the FrameInterval property.
member.value: True if any event listener has updated the frame interval; otherwise false.

remarks.p: Set the Updated property to True if your event handler updates the FrameInterval property. If another event handler has set this property, then you cannot unset it's value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebWeekView.OnRaisePostBackEvent(System.String)
member.summary: Triggers server-side events and behaviors on the WebWeekView element.
member.param: Command information passed from the call the client-side script makes through fireServerEvent. This text has no relationship to the similarly-named System.EventArgs class.

remarks.p: This method gets invoked by the framework and is responsible for handling server-side events. Inheritors should not override this method to intercept server-side events before they are handled by the base class. Undefined behavior may result from interference in the event processing of the framework.
Consequently, developers that want to receive notification of an event should subscribe an event handler to the server-side events formally exposed by WebWeekView.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebWeekView.OnPreRender(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Performs pre-render processing.
member.param: Event arguments passed-in by the ASP.NET Framework during the PreRender stage of the page lifecycle.

remarks.p: Inheritors overriding this method must call the base class implementation. Failure to call the base implementation can lead to Javascript errors resulting from omitting <include> blocks, a loss of styling from the element, and other undesirable behavior.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebWeekView.RenderContents(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Renders contents to the supplied HtmlTextWriter.
member.param: An HtmlTextWriter sink to which output is being directed.

remarks.p: The contents associated with the WebMonthView and rendered by this method include fields to hold postback data from the client, and initialization Javascript to start-up the WebMonthView's client-side object model (CSOM) following the HTML markup comprising the element. RenderContents delegates responsibility for rendering HTML markup to the associated SmartRenderer created by .
Inheritors overriding this method must remember to call the base class implementation of the method before conducting most additional processing.

Post-processing of the rendered content can be accomplished if inheritors intercept what gets written to writer. This involves passing their own HtmlTextWriter wrapping some sort of buffered output sink, for example a StringWriter. When intercepting rendered content in this manner, it becomes the responsibility of the overriding method to ensure necessary content gets forwarded to the original HtmlTextWriter supplied by ASP.NET.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebWeekView.GetResourceCss(System.String)
member.summary:
Get embedded css. If the control supports embedded StyleSheets, then it should override this method.
If cssStyleSheetName represents embedded css, then the control should return the value of the first param in the WebResourceAttribute with which that CSS-file was linked to. If the control supports multiple embedded css, then besides the empty-string it also should process other values of cssStyleSheetName param. For multiple CSSes the logic may assume syntax: "[nameOfFileOrPreset]", where "[" is a flag for embedded resources and "nameOfFileOrPreset" is a short name of the embedded file of a flag for a particular preset. It also should validate for an explicit path like "Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.CSS.Default.ig_webdayview.css".
member.param: The value of this.StyleSheetFileName property.
member.returns: Control must return null if cssStyleSheetName is not an embedded resource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebSchedule.WebWeekViewClientEvents.NavigateNext
member.summary: Event fired when navigation button on the right side of the contol was clicked.

remarks.p:
Event handler on the client JavaScript may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the WebWeekView object
2nd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
3rd parameter is number of weeks to navigate from current active date
This event can be canceled by "oEvent.cancel = true;".
